title: BP to cut three percent of jobs in upstream business - FT
text:
May 22, 2018 / 2:17 PM / Updated 4 minutes ago BP to cut 3 percent of jobs in upstream business: FT Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
(Reuters) - British oil giant BP Plc plans to cut 3 percent of jobs in its exploration and production as part of a restructuring of its upstream operations to make the division more efficient and flexible, The Financial Times reported on Tuesday. FILE PHOTO: The logo of BP is seen at a petrol station in Kloten, Switzerland October 3, 2017. REUTERS/Arnd Wiegmann/File Photo/File
The oil major would cut about 540 jobs from its 18,000-strong upstream workforce over the course of this year, the report said. Reporting By Justin George Varghese in Bengaluru; Editing by Arun Koyyur
